docs.snippet: President Donald Trump agreed in a National Security Council meeting this week to keep U.S. troops in Syria a little longer to defeat Islamic State but wants them out relatively soon, a senior administration official said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Trump Agrees to Keep U.S. Troops in Syria a 'Little Longer,' but Wants Out
headline.print_headline: Trump Agrees to Keep U.S. Troops in Syria a 'Little Longer,' but Wants Out

docs.snippet: German Chancellor Angela Merkel will visit U.S. President Donald Trump on April 27, a senior U.S. official said on Thursday, as differences over a nuclear deal with Iran and trade cast a shadow over the transatlantic relationship.

headline.main: Germany's Merkel to Visit Trump, as Trade, Iran Deadlines Loom
headline.print_headline: Germany's Merkel to Visit Trump, as Trade, Iran Deadlines Loom

docs.snippet: The Chinese government's top diplomat hopes that planned summits between North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and the presidents of South Korea and the United States will "take the fuse" out of the situation on the Korean peninsula.

headline.main: China Hopes North Korea Leader's Summits With Trump, Moon Will Defuse Tension
headline.print_headline: China Hopes North Korea Leader's Summits With Trump, Moon Will Defuse Tension

docs.snippet: Dozens of Democrats in the U.S. House of Representatives on Friday urged President Donald Trump in a letter to ask embattled Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt to resign.

headline.main: 64 Democratic Lawmakers Urge Trump to Dismiss EPA Chief Pruitt
headline.print_headline: 64 Democratic Lawmakers Urge Trump to Dismiss EPA Chief Pruitt

docs.snippet: The Trump administration is opening the door to a potential White House meeting between President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin.

headline.main: US Opens Door to Possible Trump-Putin White House Meeting
headline.print_headline: US Opens Door to Possible Trump-Putin White House Meeting

docs.snippet: Preparations for a meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin will not be affected by  sweeping U.S. sanctions imposed on Friday on Russian government officials and businessmen, the White House said.

headline.main: Russia Sanctions Will Not Affect Trump-Putin Meeting Plans-White House
headline.print_headline: Russia Sanctions Will Not Affect Trump-Putin Meeting Plans-White House

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a statement on Thursday that he has instructed U.S. trade officials to consider $100 billion in additional tariffs on China "in light of China's unfair retaliation" against earlier U.S. tariff actions.

headline.main: Trump Proposes $100 Billion More in Tariffs on China, Cites IP
headline.print_headline: Trump Proposes $100 Billion More in Tariffs on China, Cites IP

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump persists in using a phony number to justify his market-shaking trade actions against China.

headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Fights Trade Dispute With Phony Number
headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Fights Trade Dispute With Phony Number

docs.snippet: Ohio Republican Governor John Kasich said on Wednesday he was unlikely to challenge U.S. President Donald Trump, a fellow Republican, in the 2020 presidential election as an independent, CNN reported.

headline.main: Ohio's Kasich Says Unlikely to Challenge Trump as Independent in 2020: CNN
headline.print_headline: Ohio's Kasich Says Unlikely to Challenge Trump as Independent in 2020: CNN

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump congratulated his Egyptian counterpart, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, on his re-election in a phone call on Monday and reaffirmed the U.S. strategic partnership with Egypt, the White House said.

headline.main: Trump Congratulates Egypt's Sisi in Call, Affirms Strategic Partnership
headline.print_headline: Trump Congratulates Egypt's Sisi in Call, Affirms Strategic Partnership
